ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] crawler pausing itself !

bja@... wrote:

> *I am pretty sure it happens due to OOM conditions - I don't have 
> heritrix_out.log since we run heritrix in an integrated application - 
> but the applications own use of memory keeps growing and at the time 
> the heapsize was around the maximum of 512M allowed. For the moment we 
> will raise the VM max heapsize.*
>
> *It seems that after running a number of jobs the heapsize just keeps 
> growing - so heritrix still doesn't clean up too well although its 
> much better now than with 1.2.0*
>
Bjarne:

FYI, there's been a regression regards running of multiple jobs in 
series: See "[ 1123230 ] Out Of Memory after creating mutliple jobs".

St.Ack

> *best
> Bjarne Andersen*
>
> *----- Original Message -----*
>
> *From*: Kristinn Sigurdsson <kris@...> *Date*: Tuesday, June 
> 14, 2005 12:53 pm *Subject*: RE: [archive-crawler] crawler pausing 
> itself ! > Heritrix will pause crawling if certain errors occur that are
> > likely going
> > to disrupt the crawl anyway. For example if an out of memory exception
> > occurs. Also, assuming you are using the appropriate processor, it
> > will halt
> > when running out of disk space.
> >
> > I suggest looking in the logs for possible errors. Most noticably the
> > heritrix_out.log and runtime-errors.log. Also there might be some
> > Alerts if
> > you are using the WUI.
> >
> > If there are no indicators of what went wrong in any of the logs, then
> > you've encountered a brand now bug.
> >
> > - Kris
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
> > [archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Bjarne Andersen

> > Hi !
> >
> > We're using heritrix integrated into our own application - it
> > works
